meanings.sent1: After the revalidation, the certificate was once again confirmed as valid.
meanings.sent2: The revalidation of his parking ticket ensured he could leave the garage without any issues.
meanings.sent3: The revalidation of her library card was like hitting the reset button on her reading adventures.
meanings.sent4: The revalidation process was like giving a stamp of approval for the second time.
meanings.sent5: The revalidation made sure everything was in order and good to go.

meanings.definition: The process of confirming the validity or accuracy of something
meanings.sent1: The revalidation of the data was crucial before presenting the findings.
meanings.sent2: Through revalidation, they ensured the experiment results were accurate.
meanings.sent3: The revalidation of the recipe's ingredients turned into a fun kitchen experiment.
meanings.sent4: The revalidation process acted as a truth-check for the information.
meanings.sent5: Revalidation helped double-check and confirm the correctness of the details.

meanings.definition: To reassert the validity or authority of something
meanings.sent1: He needed to revalidate his claim with further evidence.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to revalidate their commitment to customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: She playfully challenged him to revalidate his victory in the game.
meanings.sent4: The team had to revalidate their strategy to stay competitive.
meanings.sent5: Revalidating their trust in each other strengthened their bond.
